alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Stokes; Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 8:13PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Widespread showers and isolated thunderstorms will produce gusty winds from the Alleghany Highlands to the Roanoke Valley to the foothills of northwest North Carolina through 915 PM EST... At 809 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers and isolated thunderstorm along a line extending from near Warm Springs to Salem to Dobson. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Blacksburg... Salem... Mount Airy... Vinton... and Lexington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
